usefulItems: airtight jars or containers, blanket, refrigerator
title: Plain yoghurt

preparations.content: Place whole milk, plain yoghurt and milk powder (if using) in mixing bowl and warm <b>6 min/50°C/speed 3<b>. Transfer yoghurt mixture to 8 airtight jars or small containers and wrap immediately in a blanket to keep warm. Leave jars well wrapped for 11-13 hours in a warm place (see tip), without moving them during this incubation period. Then chill in fridge for at least 3 hours before serving.

hintsAndTricks: Keeping the yoghurt warm and undisturbed during incubation is essential to achieving the right texture. To increase insulation you can place wrapped jars in a picnic cooler.
The cooler the room temperature, the longer the yoghurt should be left to incubate. In very warm environments, 8-10 hours may be sufficient.
The longer the incubation time, the more acidic the yoghurt.
For best results, make sure all utensils are very clean before making yoghurt.
Avoid using low-fat milk or low-fat yoghurt for this recipe.
Milk powder helps the yoghurt to set.
If using raw milk, heat milk <b>10 min/90°C/speed 2,<b> then allow the milk to cool to room temperature before starting the recipe.
The heating and cooling process described for raw milk can also be used with pasteurised milk to produce a thicker consistency.
Remember to reserve some plain yoghurt as a starting culture for the next batch.
For sweetened yoghurt, add <b>40 g sugar<b> along with the other ingredients.
For creamy yoghurt, add <b>100 g cream<b> along with the other ingredients.
